Articles.Content: Sorry if there is a resource that explains this that I haven't seen yet, but it appears there will eventually be a campaign mode for the game. How will this work?

well i know there will be a tech tree where you will have to research parts to get them and you must start with the old beat up parts and you will have to manage you space program economically attract attention by performing missions you will have to train and hire kerbonauts and thats about all i know

Aye, that's about all that's been confirmed by HarvesteR. Be aware, though, although a Campaign Mode is planned, work on it has not yet begun (as far as anyone other than Squad themselves is aware), so when it finally comes, it may be vastly different even from HarvesteR's vague ideas.

He's posted every now and then on the subject, usually to the effect of aceassasin's words. The plan is something along the lines of:

-- There will be a tech tree of sorts (player begins with junk parts "found on the side of the road" or similar, working their way up to more advanced or Sci-Fi tech)

-- You'll start with a set amount of funding and will be able to get more (publicity, completing set tasks, etc.)

-- There *may* be a vaguely political aspect

-- There will *probably* be consequences for unnecessary risks/damage to crew and property

That's about all that's been tentatively confirmed by Harv, and much of it is still speculation even by him. Nobody knows what form it'll take until they get round to making it.

My understanding is they are taking inspiration from Buzz Aldrin's Race Into Space.

Some features that probably/possibly will be included...

* Tech tree, both new parts and improvements

* Economic management (ie. revenue and expenses, including repairing damaged KSP facilities)

* Hire and train kerbonauts

* Part recovery

* Missions

* Some narrative of sorts as well I would think

I'm reasonably certain there'll be a sort of public opinion level. Most notably mentioned in the recent live stream they were talking about if You ran out of money, the government would bail you out, but "public opinion would go straight down"
i just hope that there would be some degree of "sandbox" still around. i eagerly await a campaign but the ability to blow up 20 rockets and not hesitate a second is great
Yes, I think Harv said there'll be separate Campaign and Sandbox modes.

If you want to play Buzz Aldrin's Race into Space the original developers have created an official open source version of the game with a number of bug fixes and improvements, it still looks like the 20 year old PC version though:

http://www.sourceforge.net/projects/raceintospace
